description: Organic chemistry is the study of compounds containing carbon, emphasizing the structures and
mechanisms of reaction of these molecules. This course focuses on structure, nomenclature, and
reactions of aliphatic and alicyclic compounds, including aspects of stereochemistry and
spectroscopic identification of these compounds.  A full treatment of introductory organic chemistry
requires subsequent enrollment in Chemistry 248.  Prerequisite: Chemistry 126, or Chemistry/Biology
127, or permission of instructor.  Offered annually in the fall semester.
